Aggregate production ('000 metric tons, may include official, semi-official or estimated data): Total cereals 3,746.3 in 2020, 3,645.1 in 2021, 3,023.8 in 2022; Total fruit (primary) 281.7 in 2020, 262.7 in 2021, 266.2 in 2022; Total oilcrops 545.7 in 2020, 453.1 in 2021, 449.2 in 2022; Total roots and tubers 174.3 in 2020, 127.8 on 2021, 103.4 in 2022; Total vegetables (primary) 1,427.4 in 2020, 1,005.3 in 2021, 890.6 in 2022.
2022: Production assumed to be unchanged from 2021 (FAO estimates).
2021-22: Production assumed to be unchanged from 2020.
2017: Motor spirit (petrol) 1,005; Gas-diesel oil (distillate fuel oil) 1,492; Electrical energy (million kWh) 11,986.
2018: Motor spirit (petrol) 895; Gas-diesel oil (distillate fuel oil) 1,556; Electrical energy (million kWh) 13,632.

sources.source-info: UN Industrial Commodity Statistics Database; UN Energy Statistics Database

ss-entry-simple.content-note:
Note: On 1 January 2023 Croatia became the 20th member of the eurozone currency union, adopting the euro as its official currency with a fixed exchange rate of 7.5345 kuna per euro. The kuna continued to circulate as legal tender for a two-week period in January 2023, after which it was
free to exchange at a range of financial institutions until the end of 2023.
